meanings.definition: A person who speaks in a muffled or indistinct manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had trouble understanding the quiet mouthers in the back of the class.
meanings.sent2: The audience struggled to hear the muffled words of the mouthers on stage.
meanings.sent3: The group of mouthers at the library whispered so softly that even the books couldn't hear them.
meanings.sent4: In the crowded room, the speaker's voice blended with the other mouthers like a hidden melody.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious figure in the movie was known as the master of mouthers, always speaking in whispers.

meanings.definition: A person who excessively talks or complains.
meanings.sent1: At the meeting, the constant mouthers made it hard to focus on the main discussion.
meanings.sent2: The group chat was filled with messages from the habitual mouthers about every little detail.
meanings.sent3: The mouthers at the party wouldn't stop talking, even when the music was playing loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was the king of mouthers, always finding something to complain about.
meanings.sent5: The mouthers in the office were known for their never-ending stories and complaints.

meanings.definition: A person who kisses or caresses with their mouth.
meanings.sent1: The romantic movie featured a couple of passionate mouthers in a loving embrace.
meanings.sent2: The young lovers were known as the sweetest mouthers in the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The playful mouthers in the park were caught stealing kisses under the tree.
meanings.sent4: Their first kiss was magical, like two perfect mouthers meeting for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph captured the moment of the two mouthers sharing a tender kiss.

meanings.definition: A person who eats or consumes food.
meanings.sent1: The hungry mouthers at the picnic devoured all the sandwiches in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The competitive eater was known as one of the fastest mouthers in the contest.
meanings.sent3: The mouthers at the buffet lined up eagerly, ready to enjoy the delicious spread.
meanings.sent4: The mouthers at the family dinner table enjoyed the homemade meal with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The mouthers at the food festival tried every dish, savoring each bite with delight.
